info.title: CircleCI API
info.description:
This describes the resources that make up the CircleCI API v2.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

get.description: List all contexts for an owner.

id.description: The unique ID of the context.

name.description: The user defined name of the context.

created_at.description: The date and time the context was created.

next_page_token.description: A token to pass as a `page-token` query parameter to return the next page of results.

parameters.name: owner-id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the owner of the context. Specify either this or owner-slug.

parameters.name: owner-slug
parameters.description: A string that represents an organization. Specify either this or owner-id. Cannot be used for accounts.

parameters.name: owner-type
parameters.description: The type of the owner. Defaults to "organization". Accounts are only used as context owners in server.

parameters.name: page-token
parameters.description: A token to retrieve the next page of results.

x-codeSamples.source:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection('circleci.com')

headers = { 'Circle-Token': 'CIRCLE_TOKEN' }

conn.request('GET', '/api/v2/context?owner-id=c65b68ef-e73b-4bf2-be9a-7a322a9df150&page-token=NEXT_PAGE_TOKEN', headers=headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode('utf-8'))

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://circleci.com/api/v2/context?owner-id=c65b68ef-e73b-4bf2-be9a-7a322a9df150&page-token=NEXT_PAGE_TOKEN"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("Circle-Token", "CIRCLE_TOKEN")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://circleci.com/api/v2/context?owner-id=c65b68ef-e73b-4bf2-be9a-7a322a9df150&page-token=NEXT_PAGE_TOKEN' \
  --header "Circle-Token: ${CIRCLE_TOKEN}"

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI('https://circleci.com/api/v2/context?owner-id=c65b68ef-e73b-4bf2-be9a-7a322a9df150&page-token=NEXT_PAGE_TOKEN')

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request['Circle-Token'] = 'CIRCLE_TOKEN'

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

id.description: The unique ID of the context.

name.description: The user defined name of the context.

created_at.description: The date and time the context was created.

name.description: The user defined name of the context.

id.description: The unique ID of the owner of the context. Specify either this or slug.

type.description: The type of the owner. Defaults to "organization". Accounts are only used as context owners in server.

slug.description: A string that represents an organization. Specify either this or id. Cannot be used for accounts.

type.description: The type of owner. Defaults to "organization". Accounts are only used as context owners in server and must be specified by an id instead of a slug.

x-codeSamples.source:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("circleci.com")

payload = "{\"name\":\"string\",\"owner\":{\"id\":\"string\",\"type\":\"organization\"}}"

headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json",
    'authorization': "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH"
    }

conn.request("POST", "/api/v2/context", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://circleci.com/api/v2/context"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"name\":\"string\",\"owner\":{\"id\":\"string\",\"type\":\"organization\"}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("authorization", "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://circleci.com/api/v2/context \
  --header 'authorization: Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"name":"string","owner":{"id":"string","type":"organization"}}'

parameters.name: context-id
parameters.description: ID of the context (UUID)

get.summary: Get summary metrics and trends for a project across it's workflows and branches
get.description:
Get summary metrics and trends for a project at workflow and branch level. 
             Workflow runs going back at most 90 days are included in the aggregation window. 
             Trends are only supported upto last 30 days. 
             Metrics are refreshed daily, and thus may not include executions from the last 24 hours. 
             Please note that Insights is not a real time financial reporting tool and should not be used for credit reporting. 
             The most up to date credit information can be found in Plan Overview in the CircleCI UI.

200.description: Aggregated summary metrics and trends by workflow and branches

org_id.description: The unique ID of the organization

project_id.description: The unique ID of the project

total_credits_used.description: The total credits consumed over the current timeseries interval.

throughput.description: The average number of runs per day.

metrics.description: Metrics aggregated across all workflows and branches for a project.

total_runs.description: The trend value for total number of runs.

total_credits_used.description: The trend value for total credits consumed.

success_rate.description: The trend value for the success rate.

throughput.description: Trend value for the average number of runs per day.

trends.description: Metric trends aggregated across all workflows and branches for a project.

project_data.description: Metrics and trends data aggregated for a given project.

total_credits_used.description: The total credits consumed over the current timeseries interval.

p95_duration_secs.description: The 95th percentile duration among a group of workflow runs.

metrics.description: Metrics aggregated across a workflow or branchfor a project.

total_credits_used.description: The trend value for total credits consumed.

p95_duration_secs.description: The 95th percentile duration among a group of workflow runs.

total_runs.description: The trend value for total number of runs.

success_rate.description: The trend value for the success rate.

trends.description: Trends aggregated across a workflow or branch for a project.

project_workflow_data.description: A list of metrics and trends data for workflows for a given project.

branch.description: The VCS branch of a workflow's trigger.

total_credits_used.description: The total credits consumed over the current timeseries interval.

p95_duration_secs.description: The 95th percentile duration among a group of workflow runs.

metrics.description: Metrics aggregated across a workflow or branchfor a project.

total_credits_used.description: The trend value for total credits consumed.

p95_duration_secs.description: The 95th percentile duration among a group of workflow runs.

total_runs.description: The trend value for total number of runs.

success_rate.description: The trend value for the success rate.

trends.description: Trends aggregated across a workflow or branch for a project.

project_workflow_branch_data.description: A list of metrics and trends data for branches for a given project.

items.description: The VCS branch of a workflow's trigger.

all_branches.description: A list of all the branches for a given project.

items.description: The name of the workflow.

all_workflows.description: A list of all the workflows for a given project.

parameters.name: project-slug
parameters.description: Project slug in the form `vcs-slug/org-name/repo-name`. The `/` characters may be URL-escaped.

parameters.name: reporting-window
parameters.description: The time window used to calculate summary metrics.

parameters.name: branches
parameters.description: The names of VCS branches to include in branch-level workflow metrics.
parameters.example: A single branch: ?branches=main or for multiple branches: ?branches=main&branches=feature&branches=dev

parameters.name: workflow-names
parameters.description: The names of workflows to include in workflow-level metrics.
parameters.example:
A single workflow name: ?workflow-names=build-test-deploy or 
    for multiple workflow names: ?workflow-names=build&workflow-names=test-and-deploy.

get.description: Get timeseries data for all jobs within a workflow.

200.description: An array of timeseries data, one entry per job.

next_page_token.description: A token to pass as a `page-token` query parameter to return the next page of results.

min_started_at.description: The start time for the earliest execution included in the metrics.

max_ended_at.description: The end time of the last execution included in the metrics.

timestamp.description: The start of the interval for timeseries metrics.

throughput.description: The average number of runs per day.

median_credits_used.description: The median credits consumed over the current timeseries interval.

total_credits_used.description: The total credits consumed over the current timeseries interval.

min.description: The minimum duration, in seconds, among a group of runs.

median.description: The median duration, in seconds, among a group of runs.

max.description: The max duration, in seconds, among a group of runs.

p95.description: The 95th percentile duration, in seconds, among a group of runs.

total.description: The total duration, in seconds, added across a group of runs.

duration_metrics.description: Metrics relating to the duration of runs for a workflow.

metrics.description: Metrics relating to a workflow's runs.

items.description: Aggregate metrics for a workflow at a time granularity

parameters.name: project-slug
parameters.description: Project slug in the form `vcs-slug/org-name/repo-name`. The `/` characters may be URL-escaped.

parameters.name: workflow-name
parameters.description: The name of the workflow.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: The name of a vcs branch. If not passed we will scope the API call to the default branch.

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity for which to query timeseries data.

parameters.name: start-date
parameters.description: Include only executions that started at or after this date. This must be specified if an end-date is provided.

parameters.name: end-date
parameters.description: Include only executions that started before this date. This date can be at most 90 days after the start-date.

get.summary: Get summary metrics with trends for the entire org, and for each project.
get.description:
Gets aggregated summary metrics with trends for the entire org. 
              Also gets aggregated metrics and trends for each project belonging to the org.

throughput.description: The average number of runs per day.

metrics.description: Metrics for a single org metrics.

total_runs.description: The trend value for total number of runs.

total_credits_used.description: The trend value for total credits consumed.

success_rate.description: The trend value for the success rate.

total_credits_used.description: The total credits consumed over the current timeseries interval.

metrics.description: Metrics for a single project, across all branches.

total_credits_used.description: The trend value for total credits consumed.

total_runs.description: The trend value for total number of runs.

success_rate.description: The trend value for the success rate.

trends.description: Trends for a single project, across all branches.

org_project_data.description: Metrics for a single project, across all branches

all_projects.description: A list of all the project names in the organization.

schema.description: Summary metrics with trends for the entire org, and for each project.

parameters.name: org-slug
parameters.description: Org slug in the form `vcs-slug/org-name`. The `/` characters may be URL-escaped.

parameters.name: reporting-window
parameters.description: The time window used to calculate summary metrics.

parameters.name: project-names
parameters.description: List of project names.
parameters.example: For a single project: ?project-names=some-project or for multiple projects: ?project-names=some-project1&project-names=some-project2

get.summary: Get all branches for a project
get.description: Get a list of all branches for a specified project. The list will only contain branches currently available within Insights. The maximum number of branches returned by this endpoint is 5,000.

200.description: A list of branches for a project

parameters.name: project-slug
parameters.description: Project slug in the form `vcs-slug/org-name/repo-name`. The `/` characters may be URL-escaped.

parameters.name: workflow-name
parameters.description: The name of a workflow. If not passed we will scope the API call to the project.

get.summary: Get flaky tests for a project
get.description:
Get a list of flaky tests for a given project. Flaky tests are branch agnostic. 
             A flaky test is a test that passed and failed in the same commit.

200.description: A list of flaky tests for a project

workflow-created-at.description: The date and time when workflow was created.

workflow-id.description: The ID of the workflow associated with the provided test counts

classname.description: The class the test belongs to.

times-flaked.description: The number of times the test flaked.

The set of organizations that a user can collaborate on is composed of:

* Organizations that the current user belongs to across VCS types (e.g. BitBucket, GitHub)
* The parent organization of repository that the user can collaborate on, but is not necessarily a member of
* The organization of the current user's account

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("circleci.com")

payload = "{\"continuation-key\":\"string\",\"configuration\":\"string\",\"parameters\":{\"deploy_prod\":true}}"

headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json",
    'authorization': "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH"
    }

conn.request("POST", "/api/v2/pipeline/continue", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://circleci.com/api/v2/pipeline/continue"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"continuation-key\":\"string\",\"configuration\":\"string\",\"parameters\":{\"deploy_prod\":true}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("authorization", "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

curl --request POST \
  --url https://circleci.com/api/v2/pipeline/continue \
  --header 'authorization: Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{"continuation-key":"string","configuration":"string","parameters":{"deploy_prod":true}}'

get.description: Returns a pipeline by the pipeline ID.

id.description: The unique ID of the pipeline.

items.description: An error with a type and message.

errors.description: A sequence of errors that have occurred within the pipeline.

updated_at.description: The date and time the pipeline was last updated.

state.description: The current state of the pipeline.

created_at.description: The date and time the pipeline was created.

received_at.description: The date and time the trigger was received.

login.description: The login information for the user on the VCS.
login.title: Login

avatar_url.description: URL to the user's avatar on the VCS

actor.description: The user who triggered the Pipeline.

provider_name.description: Name of the VCS provider (e.g. GitHub, Bitbucket).

target_repository_url.description: URL for the repository the trigger targets (i.e. the repository where the PR will be merged). For fork-PR pipelines, this is the URL to the parent repo. For other pipelines, the `origin_` and `target_repository_url`s will be the same.

branch.description: The branch where the pipeline ran. The HEAD commit on this branch was used for the pipeline. Note that `branch` and `tag` are mutually exclusive. To trigger a pipeline for a PR by number use `pull/<number>/head` for the PR ref or `pull/<number>/merge` for the merge ref (GitHub only).

revision.description: The code revision the pipeline ran.

tag.description: The tag used by the pipeline. The commit that this tag points to was used for the pipeline. Note that `branch` and `tag` are mutually exclusive.

subject.description: The subject of the commit message.

body.description: The body of the commit message.

commit.description: The latest commit in the pipeline.

origin_repository_url.description: URL for the repository where the trigger originated. For fork-PR pipelines, this is the URL to the fork. For other pipelines the `origin_` and `target_repository_url`s will be the same.

parameters.name: pipeline-id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the pipeline.

get.description: Returns a pipeline's configuration by ID.

200.description: The configuration strings for the pipeline.

source.description: The source configuration for the pipeline, before any config compilation has been performed. If there is no config, then this field will be empty.

compiled.description: The compiled configuration for the pipeline, after all orb expansion has been performed. If there were errors processing the pipeline's configuration, then this field may be empty.

setup-config.description: The setup configuration for the pipeline used for Setup Workflows. If there were errors processing the pipeline's configuration or if setup workflows are not enabled, then this field should not exist

compiled-setup-config.description: The compiled setup configuration for the pipeline, after all orb expansion has been performed. If there were errors processing the pipeline's setup workflows, then this field may be empty.

schema.description: The configuration strings for the pipeline.
schema.title: PipelineConfig

parameters.name: pipeline-id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the pipeline.

external_url.description: URL to the repository hosting the project's code

items.description: Info about a status of the parallel run.

parallel_runs.description: Info about parallels runs and their status.

started_at.description: The date and time the job started.

id.description: The unique ID of the workflow.

latest_workflow.description: Info about the latest workflow the job was a part of.

executor.description: Information about executor used for a job.

parallelism.description: A number of parallel runs the job has.

status.description: The current status of the job.

id.description: The unique ID of the pipeline.

pipeline.description: Info about a pipeline the job is a part of.

duration.description: Duration of a job in milliseconds.

created_at.description: The time when the job was created.

reason.description: Value describing the reason for message to be added to the job.

items.description: Message from CircleCI execution platform.
Information about the context.

contexts.description: List of contexts used by the job.

schema.description: A response to rerunning a workflow

enable_ssh.description: Whether to enable SSH access for the triggering user on the newly-rerun job. Requires the jobs parameter to be used and so is mutually exclusive with the from_failed parameter.

from_failed.description: Whether to rerun the workflow from the failed job. Mutually exclusive with the jobs parameter.

jobs.description: A list of job IDs to rerun.

sparse_tree.description: Completes rerun using sparse trees logic, an optimization for workflows that have disconnected subgraphs. Requires jobs parameter and so is mutually exclusive with the from_failed parameter.

schema.description: The information you can supply when rerunning a workflow.

payload = "{\"enable_ssh\":false,\"from_failed\":false,\"jobs\":[\"c65b68ef-e73b-4bf2-be9a-7a322a9df150\",\"5e957edd-5e8c-4985-9178-5d0d69561822\"],\"sparse_tree\":false}"

    'content-type': "application/json",
    'authorization': "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH"
    }

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://circleci.com/api/v2/workflow/5034460f-c7c4-4c43-9457-de07e2029e7b/rerun"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"enable_ssh\":false,\"from_failed\":false,\"jobs\":[\"c65b68ef-e73b-4bf2-be9a-7a322a9df150\",\"5e957edd-5e8c-4985-9178-5d0d69561822\"],\"sparse_tree\":false}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")
	req.Header.Add("authorization", "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
